definition: ungrateful/heartless/to fail to be loyal to one's love
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
traitor to one's love/heartless rat

sentences.english: The east doesnt hurt to call all ordered the destruction of the world teach disciple co-worker Hannah.
sentences.chinese: 東方不敗下令召集所有魔教弟子殺盡天下負心漢。

sentences.english: There have been many stories of those Jasons, but they can draw no serious attention from girls.
sentences.chinese: 負心人的故事歲多，但引不起女孩子們的真正注意。

sentences.english: Tong Tin Ho, you heartless guy, I couldn't kill you.
sentences.chinese: 唐天豪，你這個負心人，當年我殺不了你。

sentences.english: She suspected and feared that this defendant would fail her .
sentences.chinese: 她疑心並且深怕這個被告會負心。

sentences.english: Women make the men who is easy to be inconstant in love faithful by lovely cunning.
sentences.chinese: 女人用一種美麗的狡猾來對付容易負心的男人。

sentences.english: Duteous love can not contain the onerous treachery.
sentences.chinese: 忠貞的愛情容不下負心的背叛。

sentences.english: This question is splashed across magazine covers every time there's a fresh high-profile cheating scandal.
sentences.chinese: 每當有新鮮的負心醜聞爆出，雜誌上就滿是此類問題。

definition: traitor to one's love/heartless rat
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to bear grudges
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
crafty/slippery/slyboots
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to use one's mouth (to say sth)
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
coward/useless scoundrel
unfortunately cannot enjoy (idiom)
